intro: Thlaspi kilicii, commonly known as the Kilicii cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Turkey and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Thlaspi kilicii is an annual herb that produces small, rounded capsules as its fruit. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and biodiversity in arid environments.
